etymologies: late 16th century: from buck in the sense ‘deer’ + thorn, translating modern Latin spina cervina

definitions: a shrub or small tree of the buckthorn family, typically bearing thorns. Some kinds yield dyes, and others have been used medicinally.

notes.text: Genus Rhamnus, family Rhamnaceae: several species, including the European common buckthorn (R. cathartica), now established in the northeastern and central US, and the Carolina buckthorn (R. caroliniana) of the southern US

shortDefinitions: shrub or small tree of buckthorn family

definitions: a shrub or small tree of the sapodilla family, with sharp thorns and clusters of small white flowers, commonly found in moist soils of the southern and central US.
shortDefinitions: shrub or small tree of sapodilla family
